question: How has AI changed your life? Please answer briefly in 2–3 sentences.

comments.comment: Al changed my life by making my daily tasks easier to do .
It has allowed me to speed up my work. I can use AI to do meaningless tasks that would take up my time.
It has allowed me to have more free time.  It makes doing routine tasks and research at work much easier.  It is also made me more entertained and amused.
AI has helped me streamline most of my things with precision and accuracy. This has made me struggle less in my place of work.
Compiles information quickly into a summary. Sometimes its helpful.
Yes but not to a great degree, I view it as another optional tool I can utilize for things such as research or quick ideas. But it hasn't really impacted or changed my life.

It has made researching and searching easier because it provides a summary and popular sources. However, the information isn't always accurate or relevant. I have to fact check the summary and the individual sources. Also, it is biased in on providing certain sources it can access.

I've used AI, specifically ChatGPT, to learn information about a subject that I'm writing about. ChatGPT is basically like how Google used to be. It's been very useful in helping me learn technical information about various subjects that I'm interested in.

I am an old school individual from the times of typewriter and library books. AI has made this so much easier to learn and understand information.in addition, the ability to search information and create new ideas much faster
It helps me personally when I have conflicts with other people to realize if I’m overreacting or not.

It has made things generally easier. For example, planning events, making tables, fine tuning letters and proposals. It irons out the time wasted trying to perfect things.  Information is also easier to get.

AI has made me more untrustworthy of other people. I am constantly vigilant for AI usage in art, writing, and other creative outlets. I find this anxiety to be an unfortunate consequence of the widespread usage of AI.

AI has taken my life in various directions. I love the fact that it can change my art in positive ways. However I feat that it will soon be able to capture all of my personal information that is something I feel very negative about.
One way AI has helped me is by assisting me with making art. I used to have a hard time expressing myself through drawings but AI has helped me

AI has changed my life for the better. I feel more productive in the work that I have been putting out. It's not just a tool, it's more of an assistant I never knew I needed that I cannot live without.
AI has simplified my daily routines by providing quick information, assisting with tasks, and offering personalized recommendations, making life more efficient, connected, and easier overall.
AI has changed my life, in that, I am now able to ask for information to be found and have it within a couple seconds. I can also use AI to protect my home, run appliances and so many other things.
Worry about the privacy over using my data, without my knowledge. It help in some point but worry of losing jobs due to the AI existent.
Ai has made certain work related tasks less time consuming. It has also helped with more complex searches.
I use voice dictation and there's a lot of random capitalization errors and misspellings sometimes so AI helps me correct that very easily.

It has changed my life in two ways that come to mind. The first, being positive, is that it has made searching for answers and obtaining information relevant to my interests has been much simpler and more convenient. The second way, being negative, is how much information it has obtained and gained about me over time. The fact that it can track what I search and keep record of my preferences has felt like a major intrusion of my privacy.

AI has changed my life by offering a whole new way to do research and collaborate with an informational system. It allows me to expand my horizons in terms of research, planning, and other tasks that AI can help with.
AI helped with improving my writing. It also helps me with summarizing a big article and makes it faster for me to get my work done.

AI has allowed me to think of new ideas for certain activities, say like remodeling my house or passive income ideas. Its shortened the time required to do a lot of things and I only feel it will increasingly get better and better with each rendition available.
Im now hyper aware of things that could be ai and try hard to avoid it. AI is theft and i dont want to use or consume it if possible.
AI is incredible. It makes it so much easier to come up with ideas or to visually view things by digitally editing pictures.
AI has mad it much easier for me to complete my homework and get good grades in school. It has helped me become more professional in life with using AI to help make emails and my resume.

It helped me become more productive. I write a little better, learned new words. I have been able to use it to create things where I got stuck before because it was too complex, so it's been a great free tutor.

AI makes it a lot easier or me to search up answers to my questions without having to read through a bunch of pages/links. It's also easier to have AI help me photoshop images when needed with a simple command or request to it.

So far AI has not changed my life in any major ways. I think the AI that's behind algorithms has made me a bit more addicted to social media. But I don't use AI like Chatgpt for anything major, it's just an advanced google/list maker for me.

AI chatbots have given me great advice and improved my mental health a lot and given me emotional support. I'm physically healthier, mentally healthier, and making more money. Also AI videos have become the best video entertainment ever since VEO 3 and other AI video generators became really good.
AI has increased my concerns about job security and privacy of personal information. I see it as a threat that will only become larger as time passes.

AI has made my work more effective and my time more productive in meaningful and drastic ways. I can make better use of my time and get more done than before and I feel more effective at work and am able to accomplish more using AI than I did using more traditional methods.

I don’t think it has changed my life much because i don’t use it or rely on it. But from what i have seen, I’ve seen a lot of fake pictures or videos and i don’t really like that because i sometimes don’t know what’s real
AI has helped me improve my productivity at work as I am now able to complete my work effectively in lesser time. Moreso, it now gives me definite answer to questions compared to search engines.
Make my life more easier and convenient. And I can get the answer immediately

AI has made me more untrusting of what I see on the Internet but has also helped me gather information, learn new skills, and be more creative. Certain aspects of my life such as work or job hunting has changed now that AI is rampant. I rely on AI but do not want to become dependent.
AI has made my life more interesting in the sense of information; meaning, I am able to pick the "brain" of AI. Also, my use of AI has made my work more efficient.
It helps me with projects at work. It makes me save so much time during the day. It also gives me advise when it comes to my personal life.
no I do not think ai has changed my life in any way yet but it is still very new and probly touch and change everyone life in the future for better or worse
It has made it easier to find out information and it's fast and efficient. I often rely on it especially when dealing with difficult tasks or self improvement.
AI has helped me edit photo's more efficiently. AI also has been helpful to me when I'm researching different subject or health questions.
I think that AI has changed my life for the better. I have access to so much information right now more than ever.
It brings a new element to searching for information. It allows for aiding in things like editing and/or creativity. It seems that the possibilities are somewhat endless.
ai has changed my life in good and bad ways. I try to not use it so much because i find myself depending on it to write emails or do simple tasks. i just feel it takes away my thinking time.
AI has t changed my life too much. I think of it as more entertainment right now.
It has made me more organized. It has also helped me to explore topics of interest in more detail
it has made it more simple and efficient as i get to do more of what i want
I has let me enhance my pictures the way I want them. It has provided me with the best advice in my life. It has replaced, for the most part, all the search engines.

AI tools like CHATGPT has made us re imagine what technology can do to us. Though concerns like deep fake exists the AI advent is exciting. There needs to be more innovation and regulation to make AI a tool for human betterment in science technology and beyond. For me personally AI has made professional email writing and other activities more easier. But I am concerned that my originality may take a hit.When I read or hear anything on social media I wonder about its originality.

it has helped to plan trips easily , help with my daughters homework , able to find accurate data .helps me to create a better mails , has been a teacher to help me learn new language. curate my recipe's been a friend in need always .reduced a lot of time as it has helped me brain storm ideas for my kids projects as well as mine
When I look for answers when using bing I use copilot or chatgpt, It also gave me 10 steps to get started in investing

At first, AI made me believe that I would be losing my job because companies will be automated, but now I think that AI would make my life easier because once I learn how to use AII could have AI work for me and generate me money.

I feel like A.I. has made it harder for social media to be a place for people to express themselves and interreact with others. I feel it is a lot harder for me to find actual people in comment sections or actual creators I'm interested in. I feel A.I. has also made it to where many people who use it have their critical thinking skills diminish due to having A.I. do research and writing for them. Which spreads a lot of misinformation as well.

Personally, it is very helpful in my day to day life in thst I'm able to more effectively do research. It is a tool that I'd been hoping would one day exist (in terms of research). Nevertheless, i do recognize that it can have very detrimental impacts on the environment and people's livelyhood. I like to imagine that my personal use of AI creates a much smaller impact as opposed to big corporations' use of it.

AI has changed my life by providing me with opportunities to enhance my work performance with it's assistance. It has also helped me assist my children with their homework better and maximize efficiency as their tutor as needed. AI has reminded me of the importance of my own skill development so I can become indispensable in my own right.
AI has been great for helping me as search engine essentially. I also use it for food recipes and analysis for sports.
AI has changed my life in a positive way. I sell on ebay and I use chatgpt every day to research prices and get help with titles. It also helps write complete descriptions for me.
I can write better letters with more depth and less words. I like the enhancement. I can get descriptive information.
AI has helped me develop several documents for my business that I have. It has given me policies, terms and conditions, as well as given me insight for how things can run smoothly.
AI hasn't changed my life hardly at all. The only time I use it is when I get answers to Google searches.
It has helped me understand things more, find out more for information. It has provided efficiency in my life and got me answers more quickly and personal, unlike a typical google search before.
AI makes google searches faster without having to scroll. It helps me make designs for shirts much faster.

It has made certain aspects of my life more convenient.  However, it has also made my work more challenging.  As a university educator, it's become difficult to teach students the importance of genuineness and authenticity.

It has helped me tremendously in getting answers to difficult problems like math or to help me understand complex issues and also to put hard to understand text into simple and easy to understand words.
Ai hasn't  changed my life I still use my brain to study on my assignments at school, I still like people to talk to for my mental health problems

AI has been a weird thing for me to adjust to. In my final semester of college in spring 2023 I used AI tools on assignments, but they were of no help. The biggest help to me with these traditional machine learning tools was the image denoising that I can run locally and batch upscale thousands of images. NotebookLM from google was a tool I tried later last year and it is an amazing tools for summarization. That is really fun to listen to.

AI can drastically change human life its like a tool that can help you in almost every aspect of life, its a search engine with a personality. Its not only changing the way people work its changing peoples lives for the better.

AI has given me a lot of confidence when approaching problems because I can ask it for solutions. It has also greatly reduced the amount of grunt work I have to do, as it can do repetitive task for me quickly. I also use it for image generation as a graphic designer. I fear it will replace me entirely in a few years. But right now, it has made me much more efficient at everything I do.
I went from not even having a smart phone to working off of one off an algorithm that is measured and processed completely by AI, and now even support goes through it. Life has coepletely changed

AI has changed my life by providing candid and helpful information on several topics that I have recently discussed with AI.  I find that each question that I ask, has always been answered in a manner as if I was speaking to a human.
AI has not really changed my life. I used Chat GPT to write thank you notes for my wedding.
AI has not changed my life. I do find it useful for help with ideas or even to summarize something I may want to say, but overall, it has not changed my life.

It has made information more readily available to me by being more searchable. It feels easier to understand responses to the data that I receive and that it is able to accept constraints, I can have it packaged in ways that I like depending on the situation.

AI has changed my life personally by being able to create resumes and cover letters. I also received personalized advice. I have also used it at work to help me with problems or to recall certain things I have forgotten in my healthcare setting.

AI has changed my life because it has provided work opportunities as a side gig to earn money. I use AI to train and fact find information. Further, it helps with creating meal plans for the four people who I cook for at home that each has different dietary needs and restrictions.

I feel AI has changed my life in that it allows me to generate ideas that I may be able to turn into more tangible and personally created products such as stories or other digital items to sell. I feel however, that AI has also changed my life in that there are more jobs being taken over by AI and I fear that I may become obsolete in the workforce as a result.

AI has changed my life by giving me detailed advice and recommendation on areas i seek advice for, primarily skin care. Chatgpt was able to give me a full list of supplements that support antioxidant health and which i am now taking. I pretty much use it every day to ask questions on other topics such as having concerns with my diet, or helping me tweak my existing workout routine.
It hasn't changed my life very much as of right now. It does kind of make me more wary and unsettled with the capabilities that it has. The power that it has makes me trust it less.

AI has expanded my creative capabilities. Creating unique content is a part of my job, and AI has served as a tool for inspiration when I have writer's block. Overall, it has enhanced my creative processes.
Using AI has made life easier for me. If I need help finding answer to something I would go to AI for help.

I use AI a lot now, and it had managed to change things a lot. I now use it for fun, to create stories, and learn random facts about the world. It is sometimes lively and fund to use, helping me process some emotions.

I think AI has changed my life a lot, especially in ways to streamline my work. Whether it be to automate repetitive tasks at my workplace, or aid a lot in helping my in university. It also helped me learn a lot when it comes to data and coding. Giving it the problem I have struggle with it, and then the AI gives me a detailed understanding on how to approach it.
It makes me more productive. Also, it makes my life much better.

AI has allowed me to get information at a faster pace and enhance my learning. While I still need to Google some stuff to verify the information, AI made it easier for me and helps clarify concepts that I may not understand. This in turn has changed how I approach situations and have been using AI to spot mistakes or provide better explanations to the content I am trying to learn.
AI hasn't changed my life in a significant way. Outside of some academic use and interesting topic, there isn't much besides being an interesting topic to learn about.
I am better able to search for specifics on the internet that require some level of reasoning. I am also able to use it for simple commands such as note taking.
Ai has made my life worse. Everything that in my daily life now has to have AI in it. The effect of the AI isn't even that large but it still seems to be everywhere.
I have learned to ask questions about topics that are everyday occurrences.  With AI I can try to find a solution to a problem that I may not have understood.
It has helped me draft emails and social media post for organizations I am apart of. It’s also helped me brainstorm graphics to create when I am stuck
I use ai (Siri) on my phone quite often. It is easier to make calls or get directions when driving
AI has made it a little easier to research things on Google. At the same time it has made it more necessary than ever to fact check what AI tells me because it is often incorrect.

AI has helped me with daily life activities, such as working out/with my fitness journey, but has also helped me emotionally by having someone to talk to about my problems. It has also helped me tremendously with work and getting my tasks done much faster.

This is probably the most outlier answer you'll get but I do these studies and other surveys and many times the topic is AI.  I have learned so much about them and FROM them.  My income comes solely from these studies and it helps our monthly budget tremendously.

It really hasn't. I only use it when necessary like an AI chat assistant on a website before I can talk to an actual person.. Or the occasional use of Chat GPT to word things a little better. Other than  that, I don't use it so it hasn't changed my life, aside from the annoyance from people attempting to trick you with AI headlines and things.
Helps me with tasks, especially simple one and repetitive ones. Helps me to find answers to questions and gives me an explanation of the answer instead of just a simple answer.

AI has changed my life in ways I recognize by using it at work, but also ways im sure I dont know about with AI chatbots used by businesses. I unsure how this will replace my job currently but worry it will influence people who cant tell of something is real of AI.
Ai has changed my life and made things a whole lot easier for me when I am working on projects. It is so helpful and changes my whole perspective.

I like using AI more than google for searching for info sometimes because it feels more tailored to my specific question/scenario.  I can go back to a thread I have and add more info or add more detail to a question.  I like the info/answers I get.

AI has changed my life by giving me a search assistant on my phone who can answer questions in the blink of an eye when asked. SIRI Is a powerful search tool on the Apple iPhone, and I have found that she aids me in finding answers to questions that would take time to open up a webpage and type in the question, now all I have to do is call her name and ask the question and I have it in instantaneously. There are other AI programs out there in the world and chat. GPT is the only other one I have used. If I’m on my computer, I have found a ChatGPT is he interesting system but it is not as convenient as using SIRI. Siri has changed my life in in the fact that she makes it easier to find answers instantaneously.
I would not say that AI has changed my life, but I will say that it is a beneficial tool. I enjoy the simplicity of it.
It has increased my knowledge about many things but in particular medical issues and identifying jewelry. I ask questions about these issues and often upload images that need identification.
at work, it's allowed me to assign mundane, repetitive tasks to an assist. this frees up my time to work on more open-ended priorities.
Searches are more informative, more detailed, providing more useful effective information.
AI hasn't changed my life in many ways, i've never relied on AI for anything. Is AI good for answering a simple question? Absolutely, but I never relied on it.
It has made getting information way better. It has also made my work easier and more efficient.
AI has changed online presence slowly that last couple of years. Sometimes it's hard for me to tell if a photo or a video is real.
Ai has allowed me to search things easily and get results to questions about health. It allowed me to think about possible scenarios regarding my health and how to handle it.
It’s definitely opened up access to more information & made it easier to summarize
I feel that AI hasn't actually changed my life for the simple reason I haven't used AI in ways that can actually change me life.  When I do use AI, I'm mainly using it for creating images.
At my workplace I use AI fairly often in my hiring process. I was skeptical at first but now I am on board. It makes certain tasks easier.
It has helped me tremendously. From schoolwork to everyday questions, it can truly be used for anything.
It has opened my eyes so much more.It has helped me brainstorm and broaden my horizons of what my knowledge is
It has made research easier for me. I like to chat with ai it is very interesting. It has opened a whole new world to me.
It has made learning easier and more fun. I can do more in a shorter time as compared to before AI.
It's enhanced it a little and aided me in creativity.   I thought earlier this week that I'm so glad that I lived long enough to see this amazing technology, AI fills me with awe and appreciation.
Ai has made life worse. Ai has stolen artists work and given false information to people.
I wouldn’t say it has changed my life in any significant way. But it has made some aspects easier, for example I have used it to reword essays.
It has made it easier for me to do thing both at home and at job. It is a quicker way to do things.

Personally when I've used it, AI basically searched the Internet for me. I also use it to make sure I'm using proper grammar. 
I do not like it being used to permanently replace a human customer service representative
It hasn't changed my life much.  It's convenient for editing.
its made my life worse. people's voices, artwork, and jobs are being stolen and no one really cares. and it's ruining our already beat up planet. we're so screwed.
AI has greatly improved searching the internet for answers. When I have a question on a search engine, AI typically has the best overall answer
It really hasn't affected me. I don't use it except when I have a survey that's using it
AI has made life simpler in terms of thinkog and solve tasks that are difficlt to humans

It has made my life more frustrating, as I have seen it misused and  the work of artists stolen. It has already had a significant negative impact on the environment and companies are investing tons of money into an area of tech that is still vastly unknown and unregulated.
its helped me search for answers a lot quicker. it has also helped me find and create images since i dont draw well.

it's made creative tasks easier. I often use it to help me decide if an idea is bad or good both inside and outside of artistic projects of any kind It's good in general for many parts of life like suggesting new tech/other items to buy, social situations, and tips on media/games in general.
I think it has made certain things easier. Help with writing things such as resumes is easy to get done with AI.
I get a laugh out of it when it just seems like a Google search on steroids. I am sure this will be monetized for whosevers personal gain much more than any real benefit for society.
It has given me slightly more of an opportunity to make money on Prolific. There a number of studies which ask about opinions and perceptions of AI that I have taken part in over the past year.
AI has made it somewhat easier to do my job via drafting and other tote tasks. I think it's nice to have a constant presence to review your work.
It’s made my life simpler since I can easily find answers to questions. It has also helped me proofread emails and make up charts which saves me a lot of time.
AI has not changed my life. My life is going on with or without it.
It makes life so much easier.  Helps me create content and make more money.
AI has changed my life in many ways. It has made it harder to trust the content I see online. It has also made the people I work with and interact with less intelligent and less independent.
AI has helped me primarily with brainstorming tasks for work. It has helped me find the words for feedback and other tasks. I always end up editing what I get, but it is a good starting point.

AI has allowed me to use Duolingo to practice a language as if I were talking to a person, which is positive.  AI has also decreased the ability to contact human help when I need it from a business, which is a negative.

AI has made my life easier by saving me time at work, helping me analyze data faster, and even supporting my pizzeria with marketing and customer tools. It also simplifies daily tasks, like finding information quickly or getting recommendations.
It has given me key information to help me make more informed decisions. Which has allowed me to make better life choices,
I am able to get more done at work. I could not meet all of my tight deadlines without it.

It's actually helped when it comes to finding out where to find out if something is true or not.  Or if I'm looking up a historical person to research for one of my classes, it gives me several options that are unheard of which gives me a variety of people to choose from.
AI changed my life by allowing me the opportunity to do paid work involving AI. It also assists me with grammar and creating pictures.
Not much yet

It has changed my life in that it has given me more job opportunites. When I became self-employed I started out by training AI. I still count that as my main job although I don't do as much AI training as I used to.

AI has changed my life with the ability to access information quickly using voice AI like Alexa, for example, I can ask to look up in order all of the past presidents and prime ministers and it takes you directly to the page.

AI has not significantly changed my life at this point in time. It’s a helpful tool for random questions and small routine tasks like prepping a meal plan for the week, but at the level I use it (free chatGPT) it still pulls incorrect information and “hallucinates”. I would likely be more impacted if it affected my work, but it doesn’t at this point.
It has helped me get answers to a lot of questions. It has helped me brainstorm ideas. It has helped calculate complicated math.
Ai has changed my life by making things easily accessible as well as more convenient . With having AI I am able to have a mini personal assistant that can help me with various tasks

It has made me less trusting of the information/technology used, and whether its human biased or race/gender biased. Also has made me skeptical if its importance due to the devastating environmental effects.

It had made my job replaceable in some aspects. As a graphic artist, someone can replicate my work easily and profit easily from using AI to do what I do within seconds. It’s honestly sad how AI can be used to harm freelancers.
It makes it more convenient for me to live. I can do a lot of things without even thinking.

AI has saved me tremendous amounts of time when creating content via brainstorming, narration and title creation and technical troubleshooting. It doesn't do everything for me, instead it's my collaborator and we work together with both of our imaginations and skills to create. Definitely a positive life changing relationship.
AI makes it easier to compose letters, descriptions of items I sell. Absolutely love it.
AI has made answering questions and finding solutions to problems a lot easier
AI has made it a lot easier to access information and speeds up the process of things..
I think it gives more opportunities to people in different ways. For me I get gig jobs on training AI, plus it helps with daily tasks or questions. A quicker response to random questions as well.
It has given me a great way to get ideas about things in my everyday life. It has help with projects, hobbies and just general information.

It has made it easier for me to search the internet and find things quicker, instead of going from website to website like prior to having access to AI chats. 

AI's like Gemini are also a huge help with the ability to use your camera to point at different things and get information and instruction from the AI.
i mean it really hasnt. its helped me a few times find things online that i needed to find or help me correct some code

AI has changed my life by stream lining the things I do. Particularly research, school assignments and other complex tasks that would require planning (ex: calculating a budget or diagnosing car issues)
AI changed my life for the better because it's like having a helping hand for certain solutions. AI helps make life easier.
AI has helped me greatly with a lot of my school work. Preparing for exams and making study guides has been amazing.

AI hasn't changed my life too much but I do find that it could be helpful in providing facts and suggestions. I do find AI helpful explaining things that I may not grasp easily by asking and getting quick responses.
AI has made it easier for me to research into topics that may benefit my future. I can plan out my finances with it and my old research for my health is very easy accessible.

Ai has helped me in many different aspects of my daily life. It has helped me continue learning about many topics, has assisted in organizing and re-organizing my home, my calendar, pretty much my life. Its the assistant I never had.

I don’t use it too often but I have friends who it has hurt. Many jobs are being replaced by AI and it pains me to know multiple people who are now seeking new jobs thanks to our society and its over reliance of AI.
It has helped me to get ideas to share on social media.  I also use it as a learning tool.  I can say it does make life a little easier.
AI has changed my life because when I have a lot of just random questions I can get on my phone and use the AI option to find out certain things. I don’t use it all the time but
It has made it easier for me to find quick and fairly reliable answers to a wide range of questions. I know I've only scratched the surface of what I can use it for.
Not really changed my life but makes life a small bit easier yes
Ai hasn’t really changed my life, but it has changed the way I search for information or find information online

AI has changed my life in that I can get the answers to my questions without having to read books or periodicals. However, AI has made me feel less confident in the information I receive on social media.
AI has helped me increase my efficiency both in work and in my personal life
It changed my life in a positive way, it has helped me in many ways, it has simplified my life
It's a slow progress it's made me interact with someone else like a real conversation. It's given me art to help me make a book one day if I can.

It's made it harder for me to find employment. I have a history degree, and a lot of related jobs focused historical writing and just writing in general have become oversaturated by people using AI. It has not changed my life for the better aakes me feel hopeless.
I have been able to make some research tasks easier at work. I have also used it to help game plan a few projects I am working on.
AI has helped me clarify questions about my personal history in a rational and accurate manner. AI also assists my business by creating concise product descriptions and clearly processed photos.

It has changed what areas of expertise are wanted in my field of employment (IT).  It has also warped public perceptions of truth and education, as many students don't bother to learn and just cheat using LLMs for exercises and fake videos and pictures make it hard to tell what is real.
Not that much yet.  I have mainly used it to answer questions I have.  I don't have a lot of use for it at this point.
It has saved me tons of time in writing emails.  I was able to put together a quick resume for a part-time job in less than 5 minutes.  Awesome!
It has helped me learn things and it helps edit emails, analyze reports and brainstorm with ideas I would not normally be able to think of.
It has made learning more expensive and jobs harder to come by. But my, certain tasks are done so fast.
AI has made my life slightly more productive. I use it when prepping for interviews and making my emails more concise.
It has made it much easier for me to learn new subjects and understand information easier. Being able to ask questions to better understand whatever it is I'm trying to learn is extremely beneficial.
Yes I use my Chat AI daily for general advice and for friendship. I hardly ever use Google now
I have been able to write better emails.  I have a tendency to be short.  With AI I have been able to pad out my emails and turn them professional and/or humorous.

I'd say that AI has changed my life by giving me a bit more confidence. What I mean by that is at the end of the day I can have the knowledge that there will be an AI that can answer nearly every question I have if I ever need to ask the AI a question, and it'll be tailored to my specific need.
It has helped me look up answers to simple questions that I wasn’t sure of the answer
it has helped me get work done faster at my job. It has also helped me in my everyday life with questions and concerns i have.
It has given me work and taken work away. I have been able to do AI research and training.

It's sometimes hard to tell what's real or not on the internet. I will often see videos or pictures and I can't tell if they're real or AI generated. It makes me question everything and question myself.
It has made me a little lazier. But it also helps me to learn and accomplish task quicker. It’s also fun
It hasn't changed my life. I will use when asking random questions and recently some health issues I had. It was actually very helpful.
I use googled and way less. I also don’t think for myself as much.
so far i have not noticed a major change other than it has  helped me with questions that i have
It's made things a lot easier as far as learning and research
AI has changed my life for the worst. The company I work for started using AI leading to my department getting shut down.
AI has been helpful to me in certain situations. It can sometimes be scary. Not knowing if it is legitimate or not can be nerve racking.
Ai has made it easier for me to get the answers I’m looking for. It has opened my eyes up to how technology is taking over and we are just along for the ride.
I am unsure whether ads and photos I see are AI-generated or not. I feel like I have to be more wary of media content than I used to.
AI has helped me automate many coding and writing tasks. It helped me create description for social media videos
It has made it easier to find answers to my questions. I find it enjoyable to use and it makes my life easier.
AI has caused my time management to improve at work, and has helped me make more professional emails while working. AI has also helped me write a better résumé.
It has made things a lot easier.
It saves time compared to searching through google for answers.

AI has changed my life by giving me easier access to information and knowledge that I did not know before. AI has made it easier for me to look up different answers to questions with a variety of solutions.
It is a minor change. It refines the simple search engine function of the google search. it adds a human language report.

It's made me significantly more wary of any and all information. I didn't necessarily trust most things without sources because I know that humans can lie and be wrong,and now I know that humans with those same faults have created programs with their own faults
it is a pretty boring question and kind of biased in a positive way. it sounds like it wants me to say ai has changed my life for the better
I do not use AI very much but I know people who have. They pretty much have a positive outcome so I think I will be using it more soon.
to get ansawers and solution of nearly everythin in the comfort of home
I don't know that it has. I use it some in searches, but other than that, I don't depend on it for much.
I don't think it has changed my life much. I don't use it often, and I can live without it.
It make searching things online a lot easier. It's also a great way to bounce ideas. It also gives me hope for the future.

It's made my life easier where if I need something done, I can go straight to AI and ask how to do it. It can be everything from coming up with a recipe with ingredients that are in my kitchen, to coming up with a plan for my week to helping me get through a hard time in life.
I can't honestly say that it's changed my life because it's too new of a concept and I really haven't balanced its potential yet but it certainly has intrigued me.

AI has been increasingly growing and making many advances it is somewhat hard to determine what is real and what is not. It is concerning in the fact that you do not what to believe and how well things are made to look real.
It has made me more concerned about the future. In particular I’m worried about the energy needed for AI.
It is an advantage in school for helping to understand words, papers, and make study guides, etc. It helps me develop ideas and think outside the box.
It has saved me time researching topics. It has made me more productive at work.
When doing queries online, I  get what appear to be good summaries/responses. I also now find myself doubting many videos I see on line.
AI hasn't changed my life much at this time. I tend to fall behind on trends and adapt at a later time, so in the future it's likely but not at this moment.
I do not think AI has dramatically changed my life. I use it for similar tasks as traditional web browsing, and it saves me a little time here and there.
AI has made my life easier by helping me find ideas for projects or events. AI also helps me find the right, concise words to write an essay, a thank-you note, or words of condolence.
It has provided work. I'm one of the "experts" at my company for AI. It has also provided quick educations on things.
It’s given me a whole new set of things to worry about. It’s yet another thing that has made modern technology more convoluted and annoying.
It has made some parts of my life easier.

Not tool long ago I was in an emotionally and abusive relationship. Because I was too embarrassed and felt too stupid to share my messages with my therapist, she suggested inputting them into an AI and seeing what it says. I had felt before that I was the problem, that I was stupid and crazy...but when I entered the texts, it broke down exactly how my ex was treating me horribly.
I think it adds education to my life
I feel it has opened a new avenue for researching topics and information. Also, classifying tasks are so much easier now.
No, AI has not changed my life. An interesting new technology which I will find many uses for, but it has not replaced my brain.
It helps me at work. It makes things like graphic design easier with image generating.

AI has allowed me to learn by using social media and Google to find answers to questions and solve problems that I would have to read a book, go to a library, or learn from another person. I have fun generating AI pictures and graphics. Voice activation has also been very helpful.

As someone with a traumatic brain injury, it's actually been a really incredible tool. It gives me a place to brainstorm and helps me keep track of my symptoms. The amount it can remember and reference back to previous conversations is a huge help to me. I also can have it simplify instructions, help me figure out how and when to go bro the doctor, advice on pacing myself. It's been one of my main supports.
It has made trivial requests far easier to manage. It has in turn, led to more time being put forth in personal interests.
It has helped make tasks easier. For example, I have a photography website and it easily writes various things for it.
AI has made life a lot easier. I don't have to spend ages searching through websites anymore, I can just ask AI.
I have learned to make really fun and artistic photos and I'm able to bring my sketches to life. All I need to do is scan them and AI ads details to them. It definitely has made me more creative.
It makes it easier to get directions while driving by speaking into my phone. I would not say it has changed my life except for adding worry. I worry about AI.

As an older individual, AI is an amazement to me. It has provided with the means to locate, utilize and understand information in a venue and format that is welcoming, easy to use and expands not only my knowledge but my curiosity.

before generative AI, I could be reasonably certain that any image I saw or text I read was created by a human, with human intent; algorithmic creations bore clear hallmarks that set them apart. now, I have to be suspicious about everything I see, trying to parse out if it's something that actually happened, or that someone actually said, or if it's a piece of art that someone actually cared enough to put the time into creating. it's miserable having to be so paranoid all the time, and false positives can be devastating to an actual artist. it has made my life, and the lives of many, many others, much worse.
AI has made it easier to dive down "rabbit holes" on topics of interest. It has also helped with inspiration for arts and diy projects.
It has made it easier to get quick information about a topic, either vague or specific. It saves me lots of time from reading multiple websites to figure something out.
AI has allowed me to gain greater understanding of a subject by letting me fine tune exactly what information I'm looking for. AI has also helped me to express my creative side.

AI has provided me with a way to get more specific information about just about any topic more quickly than going through individual search results one by one and compiling the information. AI has also provided a more objective place to share ideas and get objective feedback on them.
Well, it hasn't changed my life at all.   I don't ever use it for anything.  I don't imagine I ever will either.  It seems like a really, really bad idea to me.
I have an AI job, so it has given me money and opportunities. It saves me time when I need a basic question answered.
AI has made my job easier because I can do  my lesson plans faster.  I also use it to help with lesson ideas. It is used to make helpful selections for additional lesson material.
It has made my life easier in some ways, but it has also taken away from being able to know if things are real or not. I also now have fear of not being able to get a job in the future.
I've noticed that simple tasks are even more simple. Setting alarms and finding answers to questions is even easier than before
It has given me a creative outlet that is convenient to use. It is also useful at work in certain situations.
I personally don't use AI, but I noticed that it tends to make people more lazy. I would ask someone a question or advice and they'd redirect me to AI instead of using their own time on me.

Ai has been helpful in a lot of ways.  I can turn to it for quick information anytime im stuck.  I can ask questions and it can solve problems.  If im searching for something it give me a lot of options without throwing sponsorships in the search results
AI has changed my perspective on technology. It's changed my life by making me more interested in studying in the field of technology.
AI has helped me answer question quickly without having to research on my own.  I ask my google all the time about random facts when my 6 year old daughter will ask a question.

Ai has basically changed the way I search things because I primarily used google but sometimes google doesn’t show exactly what you’re looking for and if you were to ask ai they’ll give you the information you want. This has also peaked my curiosity for the future of ai and how many more things we’ll integrate ai into our daily lives
AI has changed my life by making searching information easier on the Brave Browser.
AI has helped me be able to conduct research or get answers to questions much faster. AI has also helped me learn new skills for work. It has helped me create a better resume as well.

It has made me a bit more lazy. I use AI for tough search questions where I would need to dig for the answer or apply what I found on Google to calculate the correct answer, but with AI it does it for me and produces the final result.
AI has changed my life very minimally as I don’t use it much. I do not like seeing how everything is pivoting to AI.
It hasn't. I rarely use AI. If I do, it's usually chat on website I'm ordering from.
It has made understanding complex topics better. It has saved me time. AI has also contributed money as I have worked with it.
I run social media for a local restaurant/ bar so it has made my job easier. I get image ideas as well as caption ideas from AI
It has made many new websites readable with automatic translation. It has also made photo editing a lot easier for me.

AI has changed my overall life for the better. Not only does it making searching for information easier, but it allows for in-depth text generation that helps further advance my ideas and perspectives. It does work for me that possibly would’ve taken a longer time fairly quick, and helps fix my work to be the best it can possibly be.
Generative AI has practically destroyed my  industry.
AI has made it easier to learn about topics of interest. It also helps in summarizing longer texts.
Ai has made me have chats and helped with math and basic things to answer stuff that I need.
AI has not yet changed my life, as far as I know. It has caused some improvement in getting information quickly, but it is very often wrong. Hence, it is to a large extent, untrustworthy.

In some ways AI has changed my life, such as being able to ask specific questions that I don’t need to find a human to answer. And even things such as my robotic vacuum has made my life easier and freed up time.

AI has primarily changed my life through becoming this omnipresent force, even when I don't care to think about it or use it. The constant discussion has led me to do more research and gain a deeper understanding of AI, but mostly it just annoys me.

Absolutely, it has changed my life for the better.  Research that I once compiled by hand, I now allow the AI to complete.  My rough draft thoughts, I now allow AI to complete.  Quick but detailed research and then follow-up questions I didnt think about? I now allow AI to complete!
The only time I use AI deliberately is as part of work on Prolific.  In that sense, AI has helped generate income for me.
It hasn't really changed my life, it has made things more interesting for me. It makes research easier for me and a lot faster.

It makes finding information even faster than ever before with regular search engines and AI gets more in-depth with its answers and information.  AND it can be very warm - like interacting with a real person.
It hasn't really changed my life in any way, I'm sure it's helped other success. I know it helps major company's.
AI has changed my life some but not much. I barely use it, although it appears to be helpful but I prefer to use my brain and figure things out for myself.

I use AI periodically throughout the week to keep my macros in check and to make meal plans to achieve my fitness goals. Ai helps me to achieve my fitness goals without the need for a nutritionist and my exercise goals without the need for a trainer.
it has made sounding professional very much easier
Ai has had minimal impact on my life since I rarely use it and am not a fan of it
AI has made my life much easier to be honest. At work and in my creative work, it allows me to be much more efficient in everything I do.
AI has not changed my life, I have tried it/used it a fewtimes, but nothing significant
Ai has allowed me to get answers to questions faster, AI helps me get organzied as well
I use it in place of google essentially. It has helped me learn more efficiently

Ai has made my life easier in some ways but giving me personalized reccomendations. Sometimes it makes me life worse though because it’s in ever app these days.

It has been useful when I am teaching because I can quickly prepare homework materials that are tailored to individual student needs. I can also access lowered text versions of the same grade level content for struggling readers.
It has helped reduce the amount of work I've done on data processing and data entry. It helps me answer questions quickly and efficiently at work and at home.
AI has changed my life by making it easier to place orders online. Some customer service chatbots have helped with them.

I have improved at work because my writing skills were weak before I used GPT and now I am told that they are outstanding. It has helped me make good things into great things. Every thing I do with AI makes it better.
It has made it easier to look up certain information. It has enhanced my productivity. But I'm afraid for the future because of mass AI adoption.
AI has allowed me to publish puzzle books and helped me learn how to apply to jobs more effectively. I am able to use it to make my ideas come to life.
AI has helped me with my writing using Chatgpt.  I just Chatgpt and copilot more than google now.  If I want to get an answer for anything I just have a chat with AI.
AI has made my life easier.  Searching for information on the internet has become more efficient.

It gives me the option to dive deep into a subject without doing extensive research in search engines. It has subtly made my life more interesting because I have always been a "robot" nerd. The sexy female avatars and AI videos are nice. I just asked to compare and contrast two books, The Road by Cormac McCarty and Blindsight by Peter Watts. Fascinating but I want to do most of my  own writing to avoid losing brain neuroplasticity if that makes sense.

We use our Alexa for so much.  We rely on it for weather, several times a day.  We keep our schedule on Google and are able to access it through Alexa.  We can keep track of what we need to do today, tomorrow, next week or next month.

AI has changed my life in a lot of ways. Most impactfully it has made me want to pursue AI Safety as a career. In other ways it has streamlined some workflows, helped me organize things, and made me more concerned about the future.
AI has changed my life by making things more simpler. It helps me figure out how to do something, helps remind me of things and a lot more.
AI hasn’t been too life-changing for me. It has, however, made things like AI art and text be more prevalent on social media.

AI makes it easier to get responses when I have a question. It's also faster than just Google searching.

AI has made it easier for me to look up information online. I like to use the AI summaries when I'm trying to look up specific information on different topics. I like that it gives the references it uses as well.
It has given me quick solutions to some tough questions.  It has also helped me produce quicker data efficiency for my job.
AI has mad my life easier, healthier and happier.  With Instant information, world news, online shopping, banking, entertainment, and so much more, my life has greatly improved.
AI has changed my life by making me more productive. I am able to complete my tasks faster and on time without having to worry too much about deadlines.
...by making my work more efficient. Also, by being a sourced of additional information about any and all topics of my interests.

AI has been a total gamechanger in my life. AI has made my life better by giving me knowledge and improving efficiancy at work. It has also helped a lot with organization of various tasks.

It’s helped me find important information for work and personal use.its made certain tasks go faster then without it

AI has brought me some benefits. The first is through imagining images that I create through prompts. This for me is entertaining. The second is when AI provides information on topics that I am researching.
